intro: Tambourissa elliptica subsp. micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tambourissa, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical Africa, characterized by its elliptical, narrow leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. This species is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
